p: The development of ferrocene chemistry led to the investigation of ruthenocene analogues as antimalarial agents. Ruthenoquine (RQ) ( complex 25, Fig. 8.8) and its derivatives ( complexes 26 and 27, Fig. 8.8) were synthesized and presented good inhibition of P. falciparum growth, with similar mechanism of action as FQ (Beagley et al. 2002). All the results available up to the present moment point to an enormous potential of ferroquine and its derivatives for the development of antiplasmodial agents.
